#Text=Kirk Reid
#Text=Kirk Reid ( born 1964 or 1965 ) is an English convicted rapist and serial sex offender .
#Text=Early life and career
#Text=Kirk Reid was raised by his mother in Battersea , London until the age of nine , and then spent time periodically in the care system . [ 1 ]
#Text=Reid has three brothers , some of whom are half-siblings ; one of them was a Metropolitan Police constable at the time of Reid 's arrest . [ 1 ]
#Text=Reid made his living as a chef , and at the time of his arrest , he was head chef at Camberwell College . [ 1 ]
#Text=Reid 's avocation was football , and he refereed and coached amateur matches in the Wimbledon district league and Battersea Park , sometimes for teams of children and women . [ 1 ]

#Text=Reid 's criminal notoriety and work with children prompted the Football Association ( FA ) to issue the statement that " The FA would like to make it very clear that Kirk Reid was not a qualified FA youth football coach and did not undertake a mandatory FA CRB check . " [ 1 ]

column1: #Text=At the time of his arrest in 2008 , Reid lived in Cavendish Road , Balham , with his partner of five years , and owned a second property nearby . [ 1 ]
#Text=Criminal history
#Text=Police believe that Reid may have been responsible for more than 70 sexual assaults over a period of 23 years . [ 2 ]
#Text=Reid 's pattern involved driving around South London districts — most frequently Tooting and Balham , close to where he lived — looking for women walking home alone .
#Text=Waiting for them to be distracted or occupied , he would then attack them from behind .
#Text=Reid 's victims ranged in age from 28 to 61 , and at least one woman was visibly pregnant . [ 1 ]
#Text=At Reid 's trial in 2009 , a woman testified that Reid had raped her near his own home in Battersea in 1984 . [ 3 ]
#Text=The woman was 17 years old , and did not report the rape to police at the time .
#Text=Reid has not been charged with her rape .
#Text=Another woman accused Reid of raping her in Balham in 1995 .
#Text=She reported the rape after his arrest in 2008 , and Reid admitted having sex with her , but claimed it was consensual .
#Text=That same year , Reid was accused and acquitted of indecent assault after a woman claimed he attacked her in an alley . [ 2 ]

#Text=In 2002 , police discovered links between 26 sexual assaults in the Wandsworth area of London dating back two years , and Reid was detained after a woman complained of being followed by him , but no further action was taken . [ 2 ]
#Text=In both 2004 and 2006 , a car matching the description of Reid 's red Volkswagen Golf was witnessed in connection with two separate sexual assaults , once via CCTV .
#Text=Arrest
#Text=In 2008 , the serious crime unit of the Metropolitan Police took over the investigation into the series of assaults , and within hours they named Reid as a suspect .
#Text=Reid was arrested five days after a DNA test positively linked him to several attacks . [ 2 ]
#Text=Once in custody , Reid 's half-brother Roger , a police constable , visited his cell and asked him directly if he was guilty of the rapes .
#Text=Reid replied , " I did it " , a confession he later retracted . [ 1 ]

#Text=Reid 's uninterrupted crime spree , like that of another prolific serial rapist , the black cab driver John Worboys , was largely blamed on the failure of the police to successfully investigate sexual assaults , and led to procedural changes in the London Metropolitan Police 's handling of rape and sexual assault crimes . [ 4 ]

#Text=John Yates , an assistant police commissioner at the time , stated that " Nothing can adequately excuse the failure to follow up straightforward lines of inquiry that should have seen Reid arrested " in 2004 — four years before his actual arrest . [ 4 ]
#Text=Officials acknowledged that they had missed 12 chances to catch Reid .
#Text=Conviction

#Text=In March 2009 , Reid was convicted at Kingston Crown Court of two rapes and 26 sexual assaults committed in southwest London from 1995 – 2007 , for which he was sentenced to life imprisonment . [ 3 ]
#Text=The judge recommended that Reid serve at least seven-and-a-half years before being considered for release .

#Text=In January 2018 , more than a year after Reid 's recommended non-parole period had elapsed , the Parole Board announced that his case had come up for review " following the standard six-month process for all indeterminate sentence prisoners " . [ 5 ]
#Text=In September 2018 , Reid 's request for release was denied , and the board ruled that he could request release again in 2020 . [ 6 ]
